intro: Hoya sarawakensis, commonly known as the Sarawak hoya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asclepiadaceae. It is native to the rainforests of Borneo, specifically found in the state of Sarawak. The plant is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and clusters of waxy, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Hoya sarawakensis thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often epiphytic, growing on trees or rocks. Due to its unique appearance and rarity, it is a sought-after plant among collectors and horticulturists.
